title: Top Intraday Trading Ideas for Monday, September 16, 2019 |Nifty Technical Outlook
text:
Top Intraday Trading Ideas for Monday, September 16, 2019 |Nifty Technical Outlook

shivansh bhasinMarket Overview 18 hours ago (Sep 15, 2019 13:19) By

in.investing.com/analysis/top-intraday-trading-ideas-for-monday-september-16-2019-nifty-technical-outlook-200432001 Top Intraday Trading Ideas for Monday, September 16, 2019 |Nifty Technical Outlook By By shivansh bhasin | 18 hours ago (Sep 15, 2019 13:19)

Follow NIFTY View: formed a Bullish Engulfing pattern on the daily scale while forming a bullish candle on the weekly scale. The Nifty managed to hold immediate support of 10,950 levels and witnessed strong recovery from lower levels to head towards 11,085 levels. The breakout above 11,140 levels creates fresh long positions. Nifty is trading in a range of 2 moving averages 50 MA at 11,111 - 11,140 levels act as a resistance on a weekly closing basis. 100 EMA at 10,780 level act as crucial support on a weekly closing basis. Nifty too forming Inverted Head & Shoulder in the daily chart where neckline breakout is above 11150. On 08-July-2019 Nifty breaks 20 days EMA at 11,800 levels and from that level Nifty falls more than 10% to 10,650 levels, shows major trend reversal in a bearish side. On 08-September-2019 Nifty closed above its 20 days EMA on a daily closing basis to show trend reversal on a positive side for major upside at 11,450 levels at the end of this month. The weekly RSI stands at 44.73; it remains neutral and does not show any divergence against the price. The weekly MACD shows a reversal sign forming green bars. India VIX fell by 13.21 percent in the last week from 16.27 to 14.12 levels. GLOBAL View: There is no doubt in the Fed Rate Monitor Tool that it will deliver another 25 bp rate cut. There may be dissents in both directions, with one-to-three dissents to keep rates steady and a possible objection by Bullard to deliver a 50 bp cut. Iran has seen its exports falling by over 2 million BPD since the sanctions have been imposed and Venezuela have seen its exports plummeting too. An attack on Saudi oil facilities on Saturday is believed to have disrupted half the country's production capacity, making the United States the only real holder of the global supply COMMODITY View: Oil dips as demand concerns counter U.S.-China trade hopes We expect the rupee to face stiff resistance around 70.80 levels and witness some depreciation all over again. prices fall for the seventh day in a row, down ₹2,400 Here's a look at the top stocks that may remain in focus today - Limelight Sectors: 1. EXPORT 2. NBFC 3. IT 4. METALS Sectors Stocks To Watch: BUY: - JUBLFOOD at 1255 Target Price: 1263 - 1279 Target Price: 1263 - 1279 Stop-loss: 1243 2. BUY: - KOTAK BANK AT 1486 Target Price: 1495 - 1504 Stop-loss: 1475 3. BUY: - HCL TECH at 1065 Target Price: 1072 - 1079 Stop-loss: 1057 4. BUY: - LTI at 1610 Target Price: 1618 - 1624 Stop-loss: 1594 5. BUY: - TATASTEEL at 367 Target Price: 374 - 378 Stop-loss: 359 For watching my upcoming video on and , subscribe my Youtube Channel ‘, Shivansh Bhasin’ (Views and recommendations given in this section are my own analysis. Please consult your financial adviser before taking any position in the stock/s mentioned.)
